data.chText: 演戏似的；夸张的；戏剧性的
data.enText: exaggerated in order to attract attention or create a particular effect

tr: suited to or characteristic of the stage or theater
example: one of the most theatrical figures in public life

tr: of or relating to the theater

example.ex: These are the prizes given for the most outstanding British theatrical performances of the year.
example.tran: 这些奖项将要颁发给本年度英国最杰出的戏剧表演作品。

example.ex: Shaffer's great gift lies in his ability to animate ideas theatrically.
example.tran: 谢弗了不起的才能在于他能够把一些想法通过戏剧生动地表现出来。

value.def: Theatrical behaviour is exaggerated and unnatural, and intended to create an effect.

example.ex: In a theatrical gesture Glass clamped his hand over his eyes.
example.tran: 格拉斯做了一个夸张的手势，用一只手将双眼紧紧捂上了。

value.tran: (行为)夸张的，做作的，戏剧性的

example.ex: There was no theatricality in her long silence.
example.tran: 她沉默了很长时间，这并非在做戏。

example.ex: He looked theatrically at his watch.

value.def: Theatrical can be used to describe something that is grand and dramatic, as if it is part of a performance in a theatre.

example.ex: There was a theatrical air about the whole scene which had a great appeal for me...
example.tran: 整个场面很宏大，深深吸引住了我。

example.ex: The clothes were very showy, very theatrical.
example.tran: 那些衣服很艳丽很华美，像戏装一样。

value.tran: 盛大的;壮观的;有戏剧效果的

example.ex: I'd hate to miss out on the theatricality of a wedding.
example.tran: 我不希望错过婚礼上的盛大场面。
威尼斯建筑的恢宏壮观

example.ex: ...a white hotel theatrically set along a ridge.
example.tran: 沿着山脊建成的一家大气磅礴的白色宾馆

value.def: Theatricals are performances of plays and other entertainments, especially when they are done by actors who act as a hobby rather than a profession.

example.ex: I always was good at amateur theatricals.

value.tran: (尤指业余的)戏剧表演，娱乐表演
